Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a pale-orange pottery vessel, the interior is slightly grooved and covered with a resinous deposit, light and dark brown in parts, the exterior is covered with a pale red-brown slip and bears the remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, faded and smudged in places, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.170)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36378) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36378)
Condition: fair (text faded and smudged in places)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 235 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13424 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
